descriptor.name: Atal Pension Yojana (APY) Enrollment Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Demonstrate the APY enrollment process for a worker and document your steps and reflections.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment asks you to apply your knowledge of the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) by simulating or assisting with the enrollment of a worker in the scheme. You should document each step, from verifying eligibility to completing the auto-debit setup for monthly contributions.

  1. Task:
    Guide a hypothetical or real worker through APY enrollment, ensuring all requirements are met and the appropriate pension amount is selected.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the process, note any challenges and solutions, and include screenshots or filled forms if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of APY for unorganized sector workers and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Strengthen your practical understanding of APY procedures.
  • Prepare to help others access government pension schemes.
  • Gain real-world experience as a financial advisor or community facilitator.

descriptor.name: Haqdarshak
descriptor.short_desc: A social enterprise connecting citizens with their eligible government welfare schemes.
descriptor.long_desc: Haqdarshak is a tech platform that bridges the information and access gap between citizens and social protection services. We use an assisted-tech model with trained agents to provide last-mile support for discovering and applying for government and private welfare schemes.

descriptor.name: Atal Pension Yojana (APY) Enrollment Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Apply your knowledge to enroll a worker in the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) and document the process.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to demonstrate your understanding of the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) by guiding a hypothetical or real unorganized sector worker through the enrollment process. You will document each step, from eligibility verification to setting up the auto-debit facility for monthly contributions.

  1. Task:
    Simulate or assist with the enrollment of a worker in APY, ensuring all eligibility criteria are met and the correct pension amount is chosen.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps taken, challenges faced, and solutions provided during the enrollment process. Include screenshots or forms where possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of APY for unorganized sector workers and how this assignment enhanced your understanding of the scheme.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of APY enrollment procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing government pension schemes.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a financial advisor or community facilitator.

descriptor.name: Atal Pension Yojana (APY) Enrollment Specialist
descriptor.short_desc: A course on enrolling unorganized sector workers into the government's guaranteed pension scheme, APY.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module offers a detailed guide to the Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a government initiative to provide old-age income security to workers in the unorganized sector. Agents will learn about the contribution structure, benefits, and how to enroll citizens in this pension scheme.

  1. Pension Benefits:
    Understand the guaranteed minimum monthly pension amounts of ₹1,000, ₹2,000, ₹3,000, ₹4,000, or ₹5,000 available to subscribers after the age of 60.
  2. Contribution Structure:
    Learn how the fixed monthly contribution is determined based on the subscriber's age at the time of joining and the chosen monthly pension amount.
  3. Enrollment Process:
    Master the process of enrolling a citizen through a bank or post office where they hold a savings account, including setting up the auto-debit facility for monthly contributions.

Why Take This Course:

  • Empower workers in the unorganized sector to build a secure financial future for their retirement.
  • Specialize in a critical social security scheme with wide-reaching impact.
  • Enhance your role as a comprehensive financial advisor for your community.

descriptor.name: Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Guide a parent through the Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) application and document the process and learnings.

Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to apply your knowledge of the Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) scheme by simulating or assisting a parent in applying for the policy for their child. Document each step, from eligibility check to application submission and benefit awareness.

  1. Task:
    Guide a real or hypothetical parent through the Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) application process, ensuring all requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps, challenges, and solutions. Include forms or screenshots if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of children's insurance and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing insurance schemes.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a community facilitator or insurance advisor.

descriptor.name: Bal Jeevan Bima (PLI) Enrollment Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on securing a life insurance policy for children of Postal Life Insurance (PLI) policyholders.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Bal Jeevan Bima, a children's life insurance policy offered by Postal Life Insurance (PLI), Government of India. Agents will learn how to guide existing PLI policyholders in securing an insurance policy for their children, ensuring their financial future is protected.

  1. Policy Benefits:
    Understand the features of the policy, which provides a life insurance cover on the child's life. A key benefit is that if the parent (the main policyholder) passes away, all future premiums are waived, but the policy benefits continue until maturity.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the specific eligibility rules. The policy can be taken for children aged 5 to 20 years. The parent, who must be a PLI policyholder, should not be older than 45. A maximum of two children per family can be covered.
  3. Sum Assured & Bonus:
    Learn about the sum assured, which can go up to ₹3 lakh (or the sum assured of the parent's policy, whichever is less). The policy also accrues a bonus, which is paid out with the sum assured at maturity.

Why Take This Course:

  • Help parents secure the financial future of their children with a government-backed insurance plan.
  • Specialize in a niche but important product offered by Postal Life Insurance.
  • Provide families with peace of mind through the unique premium waiver benefit.

list.value: Dr. Ambedkar Inter-Caste Marriage Scheme Guide

descriptor.name: Dr. Ambedkar Inter-Caste Marriage Scheme Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A guide to assist inter-caste couples in applying for the ₹2.50 lakh financial incentive for social integration.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Dr. Ambedkar Scheme for Social Integration through Inter-Caste Marriages. Agents will learn how to guide eligible couples—where one spouse is from a Scheduled Caste and the other is not—through the process of applying for a substantial financial incentive designed to support them in their new life.

  1. Financial Incentive:
    Understand the scheme's benefit of a ₹2.50 lakh one-time incentive. Learn how 50% of this amount is provided upfront to the couple, with the remaining 50% secured in a 5-year fixed deposit.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the specific eligibility rules, including the requirement that it must be the first marriage for both spouses, the marriage must be registered under the Hindu Marriage Act, and the couple's total annual income must not exceed ₹5 lakh.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the application process, which requires submitting the proposal to the Dr. Ambedkar Foundation, typically through the sitting MP/MLA or District Collector, within one year of the marriage.

Why Take This Course:

  • Support couples who take a bold step towards social integration and a casteless society.
  • Specialize in a unique central government scheme that promotes social harmony.
  • Help eligible couples receive significant financial support to establish their new household.

descriptor.name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension (IGNDP) Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course to help persons with severe disabilities from BPL households apply for the IGNDP monthly pension.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS), a part of the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP). Agents will learn how to assist persons aged 18-79 with severe disabilities and living below the poverty line to secure a monthly pension for their sustenance.

  1. Pension Benefits:
    Understand the financial assistance provided under the scheme, which consists of a monthly pension. The amount is contributed by both the Central Government and the State Government, varying by state.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the key eligibility requirements: the applicant must be aged between 18 and 79 years, belong to a household living Below the Poverty Line (BPL), and have a severe disability (80% or more).
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the application process, which is typically handled by the Social Welfare Department at the state or district level, often through local administrative offices like block offices or panchayats.

Why Take This Course:

  • Provide a vital source of income and social security to some of the most vulnerable members of society.
  • Specialize in a fundamental national pension scheme for persons with disabilities.
  • Become a crucial link between eligible citizens and the social welfare system.

list.value: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS) Guide

descriptor.name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS) Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on assisting BPL widows aged 40-79 in applying for the IGNWPS monthly pension.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS), a component of the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP). Agents will learn the process to help widows from Below Poverty Line (BPL) households secure a monthly pension to support their livelihood.

  1. Pension Benefits:
    Understand the structure of the monthly pension, which includes a contribution from the Central Government, often supplemented by the respective State Government, to provide a regular income source.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the specific eligibility requirements for the scheme. The applicant must be a widow, aged between 40 and 79 years, and must belong to a household living Below the Poverty Line (BPL) as per government criteria.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the typical application process, which is managed by the Social Welfare Department of the state and often involves applying through local tehsil or block-level offices with necessary documents like a death certificate of the husband, BPL card, and age proof.

Why Take This Course:

  • Provide a crucial social safety net and a source of dignity for widows in vulnerable situations.
  • Specialize in a key national social security pension scheme.
  • Become a vital resource in your community for women seeking government support.

descriptor.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) Application Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Simulate or assist a JSY beneficiary and document the institutional delivery support process.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment asks you to apply your knowledge of the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) by guiding a real or hypothetical pregnant woman through the process of availing JSY benefits. Document each step, from eligibility check to benefit disbursement and ASHA worker involvement.

  1. Task:
    Guide a beneficiary through the JSY application and institutional delivery process, ensuring all requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps, challenges, and solutions. Include forms or screenshots if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the impact of JSY on maternal and neonatal health and your learnings from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Strengthen your practical understanding of JSY procedures.
  • Prepare to assist others in accessing safe childbirth support.
  • Gain real-world experience as a health worker or community facilitator.

descriptor.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) Application Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on assisting pregnant women from BPL/SC/ST households to receive cash assistance for institutional delivery under JSY.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module delves into the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY), a centrally sponsored scheme under the National Health Mission aimed at reducing maternal and neonatal mortality. Agents will learn how to guide eligible pregnant women to avail cash assistance by promoting delivery in a health facility.

  1. Scheme Objective & Benefits:
    Understand the core objective of promoting institutional deliveries. Learn about the cash assistance provided to mothers post-delivery, with amounts varying based on state performance (LPS/HPS) and whether the beneficiary is in a rural or urban area.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the eligibility for the scheme, focusing on pregnant women from BPL, SC, and ST households. The age of the mother must be 19 years or above, and the benefit is for the first two live births.
  3. Role of ASHA Workers:
    Learn about the crucial role of Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHA) in identifying beneficiaries, assisting with paperwork, and accompanying them to the health center. ASHA workers also receive an incentive for their services.

Why Take This Course:

  • Play a direct role in saving the lives of mothers and newborns.
  • Specialize in a vital public health initiative with a nationwide presence.
  • Empower women from vulnerable communities to access safe and secure childbirth facilities.

  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a financial advisor or community facilitator.

list.value: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) Enrollment Guide

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) Enrollment Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course to guide agents in helping unbanked citizens open a zero-balance bank account with added benefits under PMJDY.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module covers the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY), India's National Mission for Financial Inclusion. Agents will learn the process of opening a basic savings account for any citizen, providing them access to banking, credit, insurance, and pension services.

  1. Account Benefits:
    Understand the core features of a PMJDY account, including no minimum balance requirement, a free RuPay debit card, and access to an overdraft facility of up to ₹10,000.
  2. Insurance Coverage:
    Learn about the inbuilt insurance benefits, including an accidental death cover of ₹2 Lakhs for new account holders, which provides a crucial safety net.
  3. Enrollment Process:
    Master the simple account opening process, which can be done at any bank branch or Business Correspondent (Bank Mitra) outlet with minimal documentation, making banking accessible to everyone.

Why Take This Course:

  • Be a part of the world's biggest financial inclusion initiative.
  • Empower unbanked individuals by bringing them into the formal financial system.
  • Help citizens access a range of financial services and government scheme benefits directly in their accounts.

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Guide a beneficiary through the PMMVY application and document the process and learnings.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to apply your knowledge of the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) by simulating or assisting a pregnant or lactating woman in applying for the scheme. Document each step, from eligibility check to application submission and benefit tracking.

  1. Task:
    Guide a real or hypothetical beneficiary through the PMMVY application process, ensuring all eligibility and documentation requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps taken, challenges faced, and solutions provided. Include screenshots or filled forms if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of PMMVY for maternal and child health and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of PMMVY procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing maternity benefit schemes.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a community facilitator or health worker.

list.value: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) Guide

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on helping pregnant and lactating women apply for the PMMVY cash incentive for their first child.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY), a maternity benefit program by the Government of India. Agents will learn how to assist pregnant and lactating women in securing a cash incentive of ₹5,000 for their first living child, aimed at providing partial wage compensation and promoting better health practices.

  1. Scheme Benefits & Installments:
    Understand the financial benefit of ₹5,000, delivered in three installments. Learn the conditions tied to each installment, such as early pregnancy registration, antenatal checkups, and child's birth registration and initial vaccinations.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the eligibility for the scheme, which is available to all pregnant women and lactating mothers for their first live birth, excluding those in regular employment with the Central/State Government or PSUs.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the application process, which can be done at the Anganwadi Centre (AWC) or approved Health facility, and the required documentation like the Mother and Child Protection (MCP) Card and Aadhaar details.

Why Take This Course:

  • Support the health and nutrition of mothers and newborns by facilitating access to financial aid.
  • Specialize in a crucial national scheme under the National Food Security Act.
  • Play a key role in women's empowerment and child development in your community.

  2. Documentation:

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing business finance.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a financial advisor or business consultant.

list.value: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (Kishore) Loan Guide

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (Kishore) Loan Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on securing business loans from ₹50,000 to ₹5 lakh under the PMMY Kishore category for business expansion.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module focuses on the 'Kishore' category of the Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY). It's designed to guide agents in assisting existing entrepreneurs who are looking to scale up their operations by securing a collateral-free business loan from a formal financial institution.

  1. Loan Details:
    Understand the specifics of the Kishore loan, which ranges from ₹50,001 to ₹5,00,000. Learn about its use for working capital, purchasing machinery, and other business expansion activities.
  2. Eligibility and Documentation:
    Master the eligibility criteria for entrepreneurs with an existing business. Learn the documentation required, which often includes KYC, proof of business existence, bank statements, and a report on the business's technical and economic viability.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the process of applying for a Kishore loan through various lending institutions like commercial banks, RRBs, Small Finance Banks, and NBFCs, and how to prepare a solid application for approval.

Why Take This Course:

  • Empower small business owners to grow and expand their enterprises.
  • Specialize in a key government scheme for financing micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs).
  • Become a crucial advisor for entrepreneurs seeking to move to the next stage of their business journey.

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (Shishu) Loan Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on securing a collateral-free business loan of up to ₹50,000 under the PMMY Shishu category for starting a micro-enterprise.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module focuses on the 'Shishu' category of the Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY), the entry-level loan for aspiring entrepreneurs. Agents will learn how to guide individuals in securing their first business loan of up to ₹50,000 to start a new micro-enterprise.

  1. Loan Details:
    Understand the specifics of the Shishu loan, which covers amounts up to ₹50,000. It is ideal for very small businesses, street vendors, artisans, or individuals starting a new venture with minimal capital requirements.
  2. Eligibility and Documentation:
    Master the simple eligibility criteria for new entrepreneurs. Learn the basic documentation required, such as KYC documents and a simple business idea, making it accessible for those at the grassroots level.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the process of applying for a Shishu loan through various lending institutions, including banks, NBFCs, and Micro-Finance Institutions (MFIs). The course emphasizes the collateral-free nature of the loan.

Why Take This Course:

  • Empower aspiring entrepreneurs to take their first step into the business world.
  • Specialize in the most accessible category of a major government scheme for micro-enterprise financing.
  • Become a key facilitator in fostering self-employment and grassroots economic activity.

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (Tarun) Loan Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on securing business loans from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh under the PMMY Tarun category for established enterprises.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module covers the 'Tarun' category of the Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY), the highest tier of loans for established businesses. Agents will learn how to guide successful entrepreneurs in securing significant funding for major business expansion or diversification.

  1. Loan Details:
    Understand the specifics of the Tarun loan, which ranges from ₹5,00,001 to ₹10,00,000. These funds are intended for purchasing heavy machinery, acquiring property, or significant scaling of business operations.
  2. Eligibility and Documentation:
    Master the stringent eligibility criteria for established businesses. Learn about the comprehensive documentation required, including business registration, financial statements for previous years, a detailed project report, and KYC of the promoters.
  3. Application & Appraisal Process:
    Learn the formal application and credit appraisal process followed by lending institutions for Tarun loans. This includes understanding how banks assess the financial health and future viability of the business before sanctioning the loan.

Why Take This Course:

  • Play a role in the growth story of successful small and medium enterprises.
  • Specialize in high-value business financing under a flagship government scheme.
  • Become a trusted financial consultant for established entrepreneurs looking to scale up.

descriptor.name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (SBM-G) Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Guide a village through SBM-G ODF-Plus and waste management implementation and document the process.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to apply your knowledge of the Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (SBM-G) by simulating or assisting a village in achieving ODF-Plus status and implementing waste management. Document each step, from planning to execution and community involvement.

  1. Task:
    Guide a real or hypothetical village through the SBM-G implementation process, ensuring all requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps, challenges, and solutions. Include forms or screenshots if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of rural sanitation and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of SBM-G procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in rural sanitation initiatives.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a community facilitator or sanitation advisor.

descriptor.name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (SBM-G) Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on implementing ODF-Plus and waste management components of SBM-Gramin Phase II.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module explains the Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (SBM-G), focusing on its Phase II objectives. Agents will learn about the national goal to make rural India Open Defecation Free (ODF) Plus, which includes sustaining the ODF status and implementing comprehensive Solid and Liquid Waste Management (SLWM).

  1. ODF-Plus Components:
    Understand the key elements of ODF-Plus, including biodegradable waste management (composting), plastic waste management, greywater management, and fecal sludge management to ensure villages are visually clean.
  2. Financial Incentives:
    Learn about the financial support structure, including the incentive of up to ₹12,000 for the construction of Individual Household Latrines (IHHL) for eligible rural households and funding for community-level waste management assets.
  3. Implementation & Roles:
    Master the community-led implementation process, understanding the roles of Gram Panchayats, Swachhagrahis, and individual citizens in achieving and sustaining the ODF-Plus status of their village.

Why Take This Course:

  • Contribute to creating a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable rural environment.
  • Specialize in India's largest rural sanitation program.
  • Empower communities to take charge of their village's cleanliness and hygiene.

list.value: Soil Health Card Scheme Advisory Guide

descriptor.name: Soil Health Card Scheme Advisory Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on how to assist farmers in obtaining and understanding their Soil Health Card for improved crop yields and soil fertility.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module provides a comprehensive guide to the Soil Health Card (SHC) scheme, a Government of India initiative to promote balanced nutrient management. Agents will learn how the scheme works, its benefits, and how to help farmers use the card to improve soil health and increase productivity.

  1. Scheme Objective:
    Understand the core purpose of the scheme: to issue a 'health card' for a farmer's soil, detailing its nutrient status and providing customized recommendations on fertilizers and amendments needed to improve fertility.
  2. Parameters and Recommendations:
    Learn about the 12 key parameters (like N, P, K, pH, EC) tested in the soil samples. Understand how to interpret the SHC report and explain the specific nutrient and fertilizer recommendations to farmers for their chosen crops.
  3. Implementation Process:
    Master the process of how soil samples are collected by state agriculture departments, tested in labs, and how the final cards are generated and distributed to farmers, typically once every two years.

Why Take This Course:

  • Help farmers reduce cultivation costs by encouraging the balanced use of fertilizers.
  • Play a crucial role in promoting sustainable agriculture and improving long-term soil health.
  • Become a key advisor in your community for scientific farming practices.

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Guide a citizen through PMSBY accidental insurance enrollment and document the process.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to apply your knowledge of the Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) by simulating or assisting a citizen in enrolling for the accidental insurance scheme. Document each step, from eligibility check to enrollment and benefit awareness.

  1. Task:
    Guide a real or hypothetical beneficiary through the PMSBY enrollment process, ensuring all requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps, challenges, and solutions. Include forms or screenshots if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of PMSBY for financial security and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of PMSBY procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing insurance schemes.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a community facilitator or insurance advisor.

descriptor.name: Haqdarshak
descriptor.short_desc: A social enterprise connecting citizens with their eligible government welfare schemes.
descriptor.long_desc: Haqdarshak is a tech platform that bridges the information and access gap between citizens and social protection services. We use an assisted-tech model with trained agents to provide last-mile support for discovering and applying for government and private welfare schemes.

list.value: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) Enrollment Guide

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) Enrollment Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on helping citizens enroll in the government's low-cost accidental insurance scheme, PMSBY.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module provides a complete guide to the Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY), a government-backed accident insurance scheme. Agents will learn the scheme's features, benefits, and the simple enrollment process to help citizens secure vital financial protection against unforeseen accidents.

  1. Scheme Benefits & Premium:
    Understand the insurance coverage: ₹2 Lakh for accidental death or total permanent disability, and ₹1 Lakh for partial permanent disability, all for a nominal annual premium of just ₹20.
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the straightforward eligibility rules. Any Indian citizen between the ages of 18 and 70 with a savings bank account is eligible to join this scheme.
  3. Enrollment Process:
    Learn the auto-debit enrollment process. The premium is automatically deducted from the subscriber's bank account, making it a hassle-free way to maintain coverage.

Why Take This Course:

  • Provide a crucial financial safety net to citizens, especially those in the unorganized sector.
  • Specialize in a high-volume, high-impact national social security scheme.
  • Help citizens secure their family's future with an affordable and accessible insurance product.

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) Assignment
descriptor.short_desc: Assignment: Guide a beneficiary through the PMUY LPG connection application and document the process.
descriptor.long_desc:
Assignment Overview:
This assignment requires you to apply your knowledge of the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) by simulating or assisting a woman from a deprived household in applying for a deposit-free LPG connection. Document each step, from eligibility check to application submission and benefit awareness.

  1. Task:
    Guide a real or hypothetical beneficiary through the PMUY application process, ensuring all eligibility and documentation requirements are met.
  2. Documentation:
    Record the steps taken, challenges faced, and solutions provided. Include screenshots or filled forms if possible.
  3. Reflection:
    Write a brief reflection on the importance of PMUY for women's health and empowerment and what you learned from this assignment.

Why Complete This Assignment:

  • Reinforce your practical knowledge of PMUY procedures.
  • Develop the ability to assist others in accessing clean cooking fuel schemes.
  • Prepare for real-world scenarios as a community facilitator or social worker.

list.value: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) Enrollment Advisor

descriptor.name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) Enrollment Advisor
descriptor.short_desc: Learn to guide women from deprived households in applying for a deposit-free LPG connection under the PM Ujjwala Yojana.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module offers a complete guide to the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY), a flagship scheme by the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas. Agents will learn how to assist eligible women in obtaining a clean cooking fuel (LPG) connection, thereby promoting better health and empowering women.

  1. Scheme Benefits:
    Understand the core benefit of a deposit-free LPG connection. This includes financial assistance of up to ₹1600 for a connection and a free first refill and stove (hot-plate).
  2. Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the eligibility requirements. The scheme is for adult women from poor households who do not have an existing LPG connection in their name or in the name of any family member.
  3. Application Process:
    Learn the online application process, which involves selecting an oil marketing company (Indane, Bharatgas, HP Gas) and submitting KYC details through the official portal.

Why Take This Course:

  • Empower women from vulnerable households with access to clean cooking fuel.
  • Contribute to improving the health and well-being of families by reducing exposure to harmful smoke.
  • Specialize in a high-impact national welfare scheme.
